intro: Schmidelia racemosa var. integrifolia, commonly known as the smoothleaf schmidelia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its simple, smooth-edged leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both ecological studies and horticultural cultivation.
